column4: The one that's not showing up, I just unplugged and plugged back in. Dmesg reports nothing.
Tell me this, is any running 8.04, has USB audio, a USB printer, and storage devices work fine for them?
Hey, what can I do to troubleshoot a USB device not appearing with lsusb?
only when ive had bad usb devices/cables/ports
thanks for at least responding, I'm completely stumped, but the hardware is good. I used both drives at work a little earlier. Only possiblility is a bad usb controller
witht usb drives ive seen where it takes dmesg a few seconds to see it. run dmesg, wait about 10 sec.. run it again.. and see.. but that dot sound like your issue
see if 'sudo fdisk -l' sees the device

yea I did that too, I said the steps I've already take a couple minutes ago, but fdisk reports that it can't read the device (on one drive, I've got two that don't work; one visible with lsusb, the other not)
not being snooty. just, if you want to see, the steps already taken are above.
this is when i normally try the gizmo in a 2nd pc i got next to me. :)
this is a usb flash drive or a usb hard drive?
I really appreciate your help, because you've been more responsive than anyone else, but I know the hardware is good. Was using the same drives, not an hour ago.
using the same drive in a differnt machine?  Ive had hard drives go bad while in use.
it's a possibility, but a slim one I think. Theres two drives I'm trying to connect, and both were working on another machine. Maybe there are additional logs I can check, that I'm not aware of?
not really noticed any other then dmesg. If thers any othe rlogs they would be in  /var/logs somewhere
Well, I'm tired of messing with for now, but thank you again for trying to help
